snippet: Natan Blanc asked to be exempted from the draft over the Palestinian occupation, but after a trial and jail, the military said it was rejecting him.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Natan Blanc, Israeli conscientious objector who was jailed for refusing to serve in the army because of his opposition to Israel's occupation of Palestinians; Blanc's case was resolved in June, but only after the military said it was rejecting him.
lead_paragraph: Natan Blanc asked to be exempted from the draft over the Palestinian occupation, but after a trial and jail, the military said it was rejecting him.

headline.main: A Conscientious Objector Poses a Challenge to the Israeli Military
headline.print_headline: A Conscientious Objector Poses a Challenge to the Israeli Military
